intro: Chenopodium album subsp. pseudostriatum, commonly known as red-rooted goosefoot, is a herbaceous annual plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a bluish or reddish tinge. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in dense clusters, and its fruits are dry, three-angled capsules containing several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its presence can indicate soil disturbance or poor land management.
